data.question: What is the empirical formula of JMOF-1?
data.answer: C36 H24 I7 N6 O47 Pb2 Zr9

data.question: At what temperature were the single-crystal XRD data for JMOF-2 collected?
What is the space group of Co-MOF?
How many unique reflections were collected for the Pd-cage?
What is the final R index (I>2sigma(I)) for JMOF-2?
What is the formula weight of Mo-cage?
What is the crystal system of JMOF-1?
What is the density (calculated) of JMOF-2 in mg/m3?
What is the volume of the unit cell for Co-MOF in Å3?
What is the absorption coefficient of Pd-cage in mm-1?
Does JMOF-1 have a higher formula weight than JMOF-2?
Is the space group of JMOF-2 R32?
Is the crystal system of Mo-cage Triclinic?
Is the density of JMOF-1 higher than that of JMOF-2?
Is the formula weight of Co-MOF higher than that of Pd-cage?
Does JMOF-2 have a trigonal crystal system?
Is the volume of the unit cell for JMOF-1 larger than that for JMOF-2?
What is the reason for the high iodine adsorption capacity in JMOF-2?
data.answer: The π-electron walls originating from the isonicotinic acids and the high concentration of NO3– ions facilitate the ion exchange with Ix– species.

data.question: Why was the SQUEEZE routine of PLATON used in the crystallography of JMOF-1 and JMOF-2?
data.answer: To remove contributions to scattering due to highly disordered solvent molecules.

data.question: How was the porosity of JMOF-2 confirmed?
data.answer: By comparing the experimental and calculated powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) patterns.
